title: Stillbirth
summary: Stillbirth is typically defined as fetal death at or after 20 or 28 weeks of pregnancy, depending on the source.[1][2][8] It results in a baby born without signs of life.[2] A stillbirth can result in the feeling of guilt or grief in the mother.[9] The term is in contrast to miscarriage, which is an early pregnancy loss, and live birth, where the baby is born alive, even if it dies shortly after.[9]
